newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Hedge Fund seeks to raise A$50 mln.
newsitem.headline: Australian Hedge Fund seeks to raise A$50 mln.

text.p: Australian Hedge Fund, a new investment company, said on Tuesday it is making a public offering of 50 million redeemable preference shares, with an initial issue price of A$1.00 up to the time of allotment.
Thereafter, shares would be issued at a floating issue price based on the net asset values of Australian Hedge Fund.

The offer gives investors the opportunity to invest in a hedge fund within the Asian region which aims to pursue substantial returns over the medium to long term by having a higher risk profile than tradtional fund managers' investments, the company said in a statement.
An April 3, 1997 dated propectus had been lodged and registered with the Australian Securities Commission.
Australian Hedge Fund's strategy is one which uses diversification across all markets to reduce risks, but allows for the possibility of generating substantial returns.

Fifty percent of the net assets are to be invested across domestic and international equity, cash and bond markets, while 50 percent of net assets will be used for derivatives trading including financial futures, commodities, all swap products, all option products and foreign exchange markets globally.
Australian Hedge Fund said it was looking to attract a broad range of investors, both in Australia and globally.
